sentences.english: Sigourney Weaver plays a botanist overseeing the exploration.
sentences.chinese: 維弗扮演一位植物學家，監督這次探險。

sentences.english: Oliver: Let's have a look at the natural history section.
sentences.chinese: 接下來，讓我們去看一看博物館裏的動植物學展區。

sentences.english: China's plant life is enormously rich.
sentences.chinese: 《中國植物誌》是幾代中國植物學家努力的結果。
你是植物學家，約翰遜博士？

sentences.english: The historical survey and prospect of Chinese bryology.
sentences.chinese: 中國苔蘚植物學的研究概況及其展望。

sentences.english: Some ethnobotanical information on rattan were also provided.
sentences.chinese: 本文還提供了一些有關藤類的民族植物學資料。

sentences.english: Botanically, they are members of the genus "Eranthis", Greek for spring flower.
sentences.chinese: 植物學上，它們是菟葵屬，希臘語指春天的花朵。

sentences.english: Nicotiana tabacum, as botanists call it, was the first global commodity craze.
sentences.chinese: 植物學家所稱作的菸草，是世界上第一股商品狂潮。

sentences.english: In botany, Barbasco (Lonchocarpus urucu) is part of the Fabaceae (or Leguminosae) family.
sentences.chinese: 在植物學裏，多花薯蕷屬於豆科。

sentences.english: Botanists refer this flower to the rose family.
sentences.chinese: 植物學家將這花歸入薔薇科。

sentences.english: Botanists have cultivated many flowers with the seed branch.
sentences.chinese: 植物學家用種條培養了許多的花。

sentences.english: I am not very familiar with botanical names.
sentences.chinese: 我不太熟悉植物學方面的名稱。

sentences.english: Botanists believe that crosses between pomelo and wild orange created grapefruit.
sentences.chinese: 植物學家相信柚子和野生桔子的雜交產生了葡萄柚。

sentences.english: In memory of the founder of Chinese modern botany Prof. C. S.
sentences.chinese: 紀念我國植物學的奠基人錢崇澍教授誕辰一百週年。

sentences.english: Some botanists hypothesized that the living cells of plants acted as pumps.
sentences.chinese: 有些植物學家假設植物活細胞作爲泵浦。

definition: Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
